description:
18.27 showspectrumpic
Convert input audio to a single video frame, representing the audio frequency
spectrum.

The filter accepts the following options:
name: showspectrumpic

options.description: Specify the video size for the output. For the syntax of this option, check the (ffmpeg-utils)"Video size" section in the ffmpeg-utils manual. Default value is 4096x2048.
options.name: size

options.description:
Specify display mode.

It accepts the following values:

‘combined’

all channels are displayed in the same row

‘separate’

all channels are displayed in separate rows

Default value is ‘combined’.
options.name: mode

options.description:
Specify display color mode.

It accepts the following values:

‘channel’

each channel is displayed in a separate color

‘intensity’

each channel is displayed using the same color scheme

‘rainbow’

each channel is displayed using the rainbow color scheme

‘moreland’

each channel is displayed using the moreland color scheme

‘nebulae’

each channel is displayed using the nebulae color scheme

‘fire’

each channel is displayed using the fire color scheme

‘fiery’

each channel is displayed using the fiery color scheme

‘fruit’

each channel is displayed using the fruit color scheme

‘cool’

each channel is displayed using the cool color scheme

‘magma’

each channel is displayed using the magma color scheme

‘green’

each channel is displayed using the green color scheme

‘viridis’

each channel is displayed using the viridis color scheme

‘plasma’

each channel is displayed using the plasma color scheme

‘cividis’

each channel is displayed using the cividis color scheme

‘terrain’

each channel is displayed using the terrain color scheme

Default value is ‘intensity’.
options.name: color

options.description:
Specify scale used for calculating intensity color values.

It accepts the following values:

‘lin’

linear

‘sqrt’

square root, default

‘cbrt’

cubic root

‘log’

logarithmic

‘4thrt’

4th root

‘5thrt’

5th root

Default value is ‘log’.
options.name: scale

options.description:
Specify frequency scale.

It accepts the following values:

‘lin’

linear

‘log’

logarithmic

Default value is ‘lin’.
options.name: fscale

options.description: Set saturation modifier for displayed colors. Negative values provide alternative color scheme. 0 is no saturation at all. Saturation must be in [-10.0, 10.0] range. Default value is 1.
options.name: saturation

options.description:
Set window function.

It accepts the following values:

‘rect’
‘bartlett’
‘hann’
‘hanning’
‘hamming’
‘blackman’
‘welch’
‘flattop’
‘bharris’
‘bnuttall’
‘bhann’
‘sine’
‘nuttall’
‘lanczos’
‘gauss’
‘tukey’
‘dolph’
‘cauchy’
‘parzen’
‘poisson’
‘bohman’
‘kaiser’

Default value is hann.
options.name: win_func

options.description: Set orientation of time vs frequency axis. Can be vertical or horizontal. Default is vertical.
options.name: orientation

options.description: Set scale gain for calculating intensity color values. Default value is 1.
options.name: gain

options.description: Draw time and frequency axes and legends. Default is enabled.
options.name: legend

options.description: Set color rotation, must be in [-1.0, 1.0] range. Default value is 0.
options.name: rotation

options.description: Set start frequency from which to display spectrogram. Default is 0.
options.name: start

options.description: Set stop frequency to which to display spectrogram. Default is 0.
options.name: stop

options.description: Set dynamic range used to calculate intensity color values. Default is 120 dBFS. Allowed range is from 10 to 200.
options.name: drange

options.description: Set upper limit of input audio samples volume in dBFS. Default is 0 dBFS. Allowed range is from -100 to 100.
options.name: limit

options.description: Set opacity strength when using pixel format output with alpha component.
options.name: opacity
